channel.title: travel on Painter Law Firm Medical Malpractice Attorneys
channel.description: Recent content in travel on Painter Law Firm Medical Malpractice Attorneys

item.title: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about
item.description: In operant conditioning, a reinforcement (by reward) or instead a punishment is given after a given behavior, changing the frequency and/or form of that behavior. Stimulus present when the behavior/consequence occurs come to control these behavior modifications. Observational learning is learning that occurs through observing the behavior of others. It is a form of social learning which takes various forms, based on various processes. In humans, this form of learning seems to not need reinforcement to occur, but instead, requires a social model such as a parent, sibling, friend, or teacher with surroundings.
